unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – The ambitious smart meter deployment program across India is gaining traction, with significant progress reported by several state discoms. Tata Power Delhi Distribution Limited (TPDDL) announced on 27/10/2024 that it has successfully installed over 500,000 smart meters in its operational area, reducing AT&C losses and improving billing efficiency.
normalised: New Delhi – The ambitious smart meter deployment program across India is gaining traction, with significant progress reported by several state discoms. T A T A Power Delhi Distribution Limited (T P D D L) announced on twenty seventh october two thousand and twenty four that it has successfully installed over five hundred thousand smart meters in its operational area, reducing A T and C losses and improving billing efficiency.

unnormalised: The Ministry of Power is pushing for complete nationwide smart metering by December 2025, under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS). This aims to enhance grid stability and provide consumers with real-time energy consumption data.
normalised: The Ministry of Power is pushing for complete nationwide smart metering by december two thousand and twenty five, under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (R D S S). This aims to enhance grid stability and provide consumers with real-time energy consumption data.

unnormalised: Rajasthan Rajya Vidyut Utpadan Nigam (RRVUN) has also initiated a pilot project in Jaipur, installing 10,000 smart meters by 10:00 hrs on 15/11/2024, with plans to scale up significantly next year. Critics however, like consumer rights activist Ms. Sharma from Lucknow, raise concerns about data privacy and potential tariff hikes. Installation is slated to continue through the Diwali period, concluding at 17:00 hrs on 01/11/2024. The initiative is expected to reduce the dependence on manual meter reading, especially in remote areas, bringing India closer to its smart grid vision.
normalised: Rajasthan Rajya Vidyut Utpadan Nigam (R R V U N) has also initiated a pilot project in Jaipur, installing ten thousand smart meters by ten hundred hours on fifteenth november two thousand and twenty four, with plans to scale up significantly next year. Critics however, like consumer rights activist M S. Sharma from Lucknow, raise concerns about data privacy and potential tariff hikes. Installation is slated to continue through the Diwali period, concluding at seventeen hundred hours on first november two thousand and twenty four. The initiative is expected to reduce the dependence on manual meter reading, especially in remote areas, bringing India closer to its smart grid vision.
